qas.question: What exact date did Samoan independence go into effect?
What's the name of the agreement that ended with the start of Samoa's independence from New Zealand?
Where was Samoa in the order of small-island countries in their region declaring independence?
On what date do Samoans celebrate their independence from New Zealand?
When was New Zealand granted independence?
What other day does New Zealand celebrate its independence day each year?

plausible_answers.text: the New Zealand Western Samoa Act 1961

qas.question: What act gave New Zealand its independence in 1961?
What did the Commonwealth of Nations sign with New Zealand?
When did New Zealand join the Commonwealth of Nations?

context: After repeated efforts by the Samoan independence movement, <b7_0>the <a0_0>New Zealand Western Samoa Act 1961<b7_0/><a0_0/> of 24 November 1961 granted Samoa independence effective <a1_0><b5_0>1 January 1962<b5_0/><a1_0/>, upon which the <a2_0>Trusteeship Agreement<a2_0/> terminated. Samoa also signed <b8_0>a friendship treaty<b8_0/> with New Zealand. Samoa, the <a3_0>first<a3_0/> small-island country in the Pacific to become independent, joined the Commonwealth of Nations <b9_0>on 28 August 1970<b9_0/>. While independence was achieved at the beginning of January, Samoa annually celebrates <a4_0><b6_0>1 June<b6_0/><a4_0/> as its independence day.
